channel.title: MoparWiki
channel.description:
Following newbiehacker's and then Cow's suggestions, it is installed at http://www.moparisthebest.com/wiki But we need a few things:
1. A better name? MoparWiki sounds fairly stupid. 2. Does anyone have previous experience with mediawiki? We need some moderators. 3. A better logo? The current one doesn't look right at all. 4. Contributors, people to actually write content for the wiki.
Suggest anything else.

item.title: MoparWiki
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

sup000:

some kind of content > none

None > Pure advertising.

No, really. Have you seen impWiki? Every chance they get they boast(or used to) about iBot and all it’s glory.

This is not true. iBot will last just as long, if not longer than SCAR since it is a colour bot. It is not a client hack.

Am I correct in thinking they’re saying SCAR is a client hack? I don’t see how iBot can outlive SCAR, if anything, they’ll both last just as long. The only thing stopping one or another is the lack of people willing to use them.

Now, I know this doesn’t really count,

[code]# Only able to keep one bot running at a time.

Controls the mouse, rendering your computer useless while the bot is in use. [/code]

But the new Plugin for SCAR found at SRL Members means you can run just as many(if not, more, since it’s only SCAR + RS running) as iBot can using the unrestricted version(and, without using the mouse/keyboard), and, as far as I know, the only thing that can kill this plugin if the world-list changes, since it loads runescape using URL’s found on the world-list.

Read full topic

some kind of content > none

edit: why are uploads disabled… imma have to use imageshack until you sort this crap out, mopar

maybe someone could go through it and break up the huge blocks of text into paragraphs

item.title: MoparWiki
item.dc:creator: @Brazen_Bull Brazen Bull
item.description:
@Brazen_Bull wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Like I said in the first post I don’t much like the name MoparWiki anyway, suggest others. And this wiki can be edited by anyone, they don’t necessarily have to be a part of this community.

What’s wrong with just “Cheater’s Wiki”? It’s not at all original, but it’s immediately clear what it is, and it includes everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparWiki
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Taios:

I reckon we should make a wiki that’s not any community based. Aka no ‘ImpWiki’ or Moparwiki or w.e.

Like I said in the first post I don’t much like the name MoparWiki anyway, suggest others. And this wiki can be edited by anyone, they don’t necessarily have to be a part of this community.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparWiki
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:35, topic:137697”]well, i really believe that it would be up to the community to maintain the wiki

if you look at impwiki, there is very little information on client internals, and most of that is misleading, it appears as the whole point of the wiki is to advertise various bots.

MOPAR WHAT TEH FUX IS GOING ON WITH PARSER FUNCTIONS[/quote]
I hardly think anyone that reads a wiki is going to buy a bot… I believe they are going to be a contributor.

Read full topic
